course_description: This course introduces students to social scientific explanations for the causes, consequences, and resolution of insurgency and terrorism. Students use theoretical models to analyze major developments in world events. This course is designed to allow student to engage critically and seriously with recent scholarship on a variety of forms of political violence and violent conflict.
prerequisites: POLS 110 or POLS_OX 110 or POLS 120 or POLS_OX 120 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3939, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: TTh 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: R. Harmon, Status: Open
